pli-tv-kd7:0.3: The chapter on the robe-making ceremony
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.0: The allowance for a robe-making ceremony
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.1: At one time the Master was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.2: At that time thirty monks from Pāvā—all wilderness-dwellers, alms-collectors, rag-robe wearers, and three-robe owners—were traveling to Sāvatthī to see the Master. Because the entry to the rains residence was approaching, they were not able to reach Sāvatthī,
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.3: and they entered the rains residence at Sāketa while still on their way.
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.4: They spent the rains residence discontented, thinking, “The Master is only 80 kilometers away, but we don’t get to see him.”
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.6: When they arrived at Sāvatthī, they went to Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery, bowed to the Master, and sat down.
pli-tv-kd7:1.2.1: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks,
pli-tv-kd7:1.2.3: I hope you spent the rains at ease, in concord and harmony, without dispute, and that you had no trouble getting almsfood?”
pli-tv-kd7:1.2.5: we spent the rains at ease, in concord and harmony, without dispute, and we had no trouble getting almsfood.”
pli-tv-kd7:1.2.6: And they told the Master what had happened during the rains and while traveling to Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-kd7:1.3.1: Soon afterwards the Master gave a teaching and addressed the monks:“
pli-tv-kd7:1.3.2: I allow monks who have completed the rains residence to do a robe-making ceremony.
pli-tv-kd7:1.3.3: Once you have done the robe-making ceremony, five things are allowable for you:
pli-tv-kd7:1.3.4: visiting families before or after a meal invitation, staying apart from your robe for more than a day, eating in a group, keeping as much extra robe-cloth as you need, and whatever robe-cloth is given is only for those who have participated in the robe-making ceremony.
pli-tv-kd7:1.3.6: And the robe-making ceremony should be done in this way.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.1: A competent and capable monk should inform the Order:
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.2: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Order to listen.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.3: This cloth has been given to the Order for the robe-making ceremony.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.4: If it seems appropriate to the Order, the Order should give this cloth to monk so-and-so to do the robe-making ceremony.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.6: Please, Venerables, I ask the Order to listen.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.7: This cloth has been given to the Order for the robe-making ceremony.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.8: The Order gives this cloth to monk so-and-so to do the robe-making ceremony.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.9: Any monk who approves of giving this cloth to monk so-and-so to do the robe-making ceremony should remain silent.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.10: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.11: The Order has given this cloth to monk so-and-so to do the robe-making ceremony.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.12: The Order approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.2: “And, monks, how has the robe-making ceremony not been done?
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.3: The robe-making ceremony has not been done merely by marking the cloth,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.4: or if the appreciation for the ceremony is expressed by someone outside the boundary.
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.5: In this way the robe-making ceremony has not been done.
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.7: merely by a tacking the cloth,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.9: merely by marking with a strip of cloth,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.11: merely by adding a long border,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.12: merely by adding a short border,

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.16: if a monk has given a hint,

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.21: if it is not an outer robe
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.24: nor has it been done if the robe has not been made on that very day with five or more cut sections each having a large panel,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.25: if the robe-making ceremony is not done by an individual,
pli-tv-kd7:1.6.1: And how has the robe-making ceremony been done?
pli-tv-kd7:1.6.2: The robe-making ceremony has been done if the cloth is brand new, if it is nearly new, if it is old, if it is a rag, if it is from a shop; it has been done if a monk has not made an indication, if a monk has not given a hint, if the robe has not been borrowed, if it has not been stored, if it is not to be relinquished, if it has been marked, if it is an outer robe or an upper robe or a sarong; it has been done if the robe has been made on that very day with five or more cut sections with panels, if the robe-making ceremony is done by an individual, and if the appreciation for the ceremony is expressed by someone inside the boundary.
pli-tv-kd7:1.6.4: In this way the robe-making ceremony has been done.
pli-tv-kd7:1.7.1: And how does the robe-making season come to an end?
pli-tv-kd7:1.7.2: There are these eight summaries for when the robe-making season comes to an end:
pli-tv-kd7:1.7.3: when he departs from the monastery, when the robe is finished, when he makes a decision, when the robe-cloth is lost, when he hears about the end of the robe-making season, when an expectation of more robe-cloth is disappointed, when he is outside the monastery boundary, when the robe-making season comes to an end together.”

pli-tv-kd7:13.1.0: Discussion on obstacles and removal of obstacles
pli-tv-kd7:13.1.1: “Monks, there are two obstacles for the ending of the robe-making season:
pli-tv-kd7:13.1.3: the monastery obstacle and the robe-cloth obstacle.
pli-tv-kd7:13.1.5: A monk stays on in that monastery or he leaves intending to return.
pli-tv-kd7:13.1.8: A monk has not made a robe, or he has not finished it, or he is expecting more robe-cloth.
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.1: There are two removals of obstacles for the ending of the robe-making season:
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.2: the removal of the monastery obstacle and the removal of the robe-cloth obstacle.
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.3: What is the removal of the monastery obstacle?
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.4: A monk leaves that monastery without intending to return.
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.6: What is the removal of the robe-cloth obstacle?
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.7: A monk has made a robe; or the robe-cloth is lost, stolen, or burnt; or his expectation of more robe-cloth is disappointed.”
